alert.note: Alert for Warren (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 01 at 1:33PM EDT until April 01 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Warren County in north central Pennsylvania... * Until 245 PM EDT. * At 131 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Northwest Harborcreek to Cambridge Springs to near Meadville, moving east at 70 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Warren, Sheffield, Columbus, Youngsville, Russell, Spring Creek, Scandia, Lottsville, Grand Valley, Warren South, Garland and Kinzua Dam. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms have produced numerous occurrences of wind damage in the form of downed trees and power lines over the past 30 minutes across Northeastern Ohio. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows!
